intro: Ruellia ocymoides, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of blue to violet tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Ruellia ocymoides is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate.
